main event: A sighting of an unidentified object described as the size of a 'tea plate' occurred in Pasadena, California in September 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for 30 seconds through binoculars., The object moved erratically and then disappeared from sight., It was reported to possibly be a balloon or an aircraft., The sighting involved a metallic white object observed moving from East to West., There were multiple reports from members of the Air Force and the Ground Observer Corps about a strange light in the sky.
sighted object: an object the size of a 'tea plate'
witness description: members of the Air Force and the Ground Observer Corps, including Lt. Mark Matlock
